testsuite.name: testPackage.Main
testsuite.system-out:
Template generated in the file: notes.ntex -now edit the file 'notes.ntex' and/or -run the srcipt called 'compile' in order to convert in into the LaTeX and generate pdf author is: \author{Jaroslav V√≠tkŇĮ}
======================What is it: -Tool for making fast (simply formatted) notes with picture support -Write notes into the text file 'notes.ntex'
-Java application converts *.ntex file into *.tex file based on provided template files -Script 'compile' does this: -Converts *.ntex file to *.tex file -Generates pdf file -Opens the pdf in pdf viewer
======================Basic Usage: -Initialize the folder for notes, run: 'ntex init -Can generate template ('notes.ntex') by use of command: java -jar nTexProject-x.x.jar -template y -Edit the 'notes.ntex' file according to formatting rules -Run the 'compile' script in order to generate and open pdf
======================Structure of the document: -Document is structured by means of: -LaTeX abstract -LaTeX (sub)section commands -Structure is created by means of tabulators and '-' marker (as this help is)
======================Basic commands: -\title{Document name} -\author{Your Name} -\begin{begin} abstract (in one line) \end{abstract} -\b{bold text} -\i{italic text} -\section{section name} -\subsection{subsection name..} -\cite{book} citaiton of the book -\f{name,10,description} add the figure specified by: -name -width (optional) -description (optional) -\f{name} reference to already existing figure
======================Literature: -based on the LaTeX formatting -at the end of file add e.g. this:
\begin{literatura}{1} \bibitem{kniha} Allman J.: \emph{Evolving Brains}, Scientific American Library Paperback, 2000. \end{literatura}
====================== Template generated in the file: notes.ntex -now edit the file 'notes.ntex' and/or -run the srcipt called 'compile' in order to convert in into the LaTeX and generate pdf
testsuite.system-err: nTex WARNING: \author{} not found in the nTex file, will try to parse it from template file
